questions.question:
The symbol \( \rightarrow \) indicates functional dependency in the context of a relational database. Which of the following options is/are TRUE?

(GATE CSE 2024 SET-1)
options:
C.

\( ((X, Y) \rightarrow Z \text { and } W \rightarrow Y) \text { implies }(X, W) \rightarrow Z \)

D.

\( (X \rightarrow Y \text { and } Y \rightarrow Z) \text { implies } X \rightarrow Z \)
correct_answer:
C.

\( ((X, Y) \rightarrow Z \text { and } W \rightarrow Y) \text { implies }(X, W) \rightarrow Z \)

D.

\( (X \rightarrow Y \text { and } Y \rightarrow Z) \text { implies } X \rightarrow Z \)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the following two relations, \(R(A, B) \) and \(S(A, C) \) :
\(\boldsymbol{R} \begin{array}{|c|c|} \hline \boldsymbol{A} & \boldsymbol{B} \\ \hline 10 & 20 \\ \hline 20 & 30 \\ \hline 30 & 40 \\ \hline 30 & 50 \\ \hline 50 & 95 \\ \hline \end{array}\)


\(\boldsymbol{S} \begin{array}{|c|c|} \hline \boldsymbol{A} & \boldsymbol{C} \\ \hline 10 & 90 \\ \hline 30 & 45 \\ \hline 40 & 80 \\ \hline \end{array} \)
The total number of tuples obtained by evaluating the following expression \( \sigma_{B \lt C}\left(R \bowtie_{R . A=S . A} S\right) \) is ____

(GATE CSE 2024 SET-1)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

R cannot have more than one candidate key

questions.question:
Consider a database of fixed-length records, stored as an ordered file. The database has 25,000 records, with each record being 100 bytes, of which the primary key occupies 15 bytes. The data file is block-aligned in that each data record is fully contained within a block. The database is indexed by a primary index file, which is also stored as a block-aligned ordered file. The figure below depicts this indexing scheme.

Suppose the block size of the file system is 1024 bytes, and a pointer to a block occupies 5 bytes. The system uses binary search on the index file to search for a record with a given key. You may assume that a binary search on an index file of \(b\) blocks takes \(\left \lceil \log_2 b \right \rceil \) block accesses in the worst case.
Given a key, the number of block accesses required to identify the block in the data file that may contain a record with the key, in the worst case, is _____

(GATE CSE 2023)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Consider the following table named Student in a relational database. The primary key of this table is rollNum.
\(\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|} \hline \\ rollNum&name&gender&marks \\ \hline 1&Naman&M&62\\ \hline 2&Aliya&F&70 \\ \hline 3&Aliya &F&80 \\ \hline 4&James&M&82\\ \hline 5&Swati&F&65\\ \hline \end{array} \)
The SQL query below is executed on this database.


SELECT *
FROM Student
WHERE gender = 'F' AND
 marks > 65;

The number of rows returned by the query is ______

(GATE CSE 2023)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Which one of the options given below refers to the degree (or arity) of a relation in relational database systems?

(GATE CSE 2023)
options:
A.

Number of attributes of its relation schema.

B.

Number of tuples stored in the relation.

D.

Number of distinct domains of its relation schema.
questions.correct_answer:
A.

Number of attributes of its relation schema.

questions.question:

S: \(R_4(x)R_2(x)R_3(x)R_1(y)W_1(y)W_2 (x)W_3 (y)R_4(y)\)

Which one of the following serial schedules is conflict equivalent to \(S\)?

(GATE CSE 2022)

questions.question:
In a relational data model, which one of the following statements is TRUE?

(GATE CSE 2022)
options:
A.

A relation with only two attributes is always in BCNF.

B.

If all attributes of a relation are prime attributes, then the relation is in BCNF.

C.

Every relation has at least one non-prime attribute.
questions.correct_answer:
A.

A relation with only two attributes is always in BCNF.
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Suppose the following functional dependencies hold on a relation U with attributes \(P, Q, R, S, \text{ and } T\):

\(P \rightarrow QR \\ RS \rightarrow T\)

Which of the following functional dependencies can be inferred from the above functional dependencies?

(GATE CSE 2021 SET-2)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Let S be the following schedule of operations of three transactions \(T_1, T_2 \text{ and }T_3\) in a relational database system:

\(R_2(Y), R_1(X), R_3(Z), R_1(Y)W_1(X), R_2(Z), W_2(Y), R_3(X), W_3(Z)\)

Consider the statements P and Q below:

P: S is conflict-serializable.
Q: If \(T_3\) commits before \(T_1\) finishes, then S is recoverable.

Which one of the following choices is correct?

(GATE CSE 2021 SET-2)
options:
B.

P is true and Q is false

C.

P is false and Q is true
questions.correct_answer:
B.

P is true and Q is false
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
The relation scheme given below is used to store information about the employees of a company, where empId is the key and deptId indicates the department to which the employee is assigned. Each employee is assigned to exactly one department.

\(\textsf{emp($\underline{\textsf{empId}}$, name, gender, salary, deptId)}\)

Consider the following SQL query:

 select deptId, count(*)
from emp
where gender = "female" and salary > (select avg(salary)from emp)
group by deptId;
The above query gives, for each department in the company, the number of female employees whose salary is greater than the average salary of

(GATE CSE 2021 SET-2)
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow
